t: O Lord, Be Gracious to Me
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.
Blessed*pn is the one who considers the poor! In*ld the day of trouble the Lord*s delivers him;
the*ln Lord*s protects him and keeps him alive; he*ld is called blessed in the land; you*ld do not give him up to the will of his enemies.
The*ln Lord*s sustains him on his sickbed; in*ld his illness you restore him to full health.
As*pn for me, I said, “O Lord,*s be gracious to me; heal*ld me, for I have sinned against you!”
My*ln enemies say of me in malice, “When*ld will he die, and his name perish?”
And*ln when one comes to see me, he utters empty words, while*ld his heart gathers iniquity; when*ld he goes out, he tells it abroad.
All*ln who hate me whisper together about me; they*ld imagine the worst for me.
They*pn say, “A deadly thing is poured out on him; he*ld will not rise again from where he lies.”
Even*ln my close friend in whom I trusted, who*ld ate my bread, has lifted his heel against me.
But*ln you, O Lord,*s be gracious to me, and*ld raise me up, that I may repay them!
By*pn this I know that you delight in me: my*ld enemy will not shout in triumph over me.
But*ln you have upheld me because of my integrity, and*ld set me in your presence forever.
Blessed*pn be the Lord,*s the God of Israel, from*ld everlasting to everlasting! Amen*l and Amen.
